question.body: Which of the following is the correct order that air passes through structures in the respiratory system during inspiration?

multiple_choice.choice: Lungs, bronchi, trachea, larynx, pharynx, nasal cavities
Lungs, bronchi, trachea, pharynx, larynx, nasal cavities
Nasal cavities, pharynx, larynx, trachea, bronchi, lungs
Nasal cavities, larynx, pharynx, trachea, bronchi, lungs

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is the correct flow of air through the respiratory structures during exhalation. Exhalation is also expiration and the air is moving out of the body.
Incorrect. This is the correct flow of air through the respiratory structures during exhalation,except that the larynx should follow the trachea.
Correct. This is the correct flow of air through the respiratory structures during inhalation. Inhalation is also inspiration and is air moving into the body.
Incorrect. This is the correct flow of the air through the respiratory structures during inhalation, except that the pharynx should come before the larynx.
